page.title: 04Garton Darby and Joan Club
page.content: Garton and Tibthorpe Darby and Joan Club was started in 1971 to provide care, concern and entertainment for elderly people.The club with approximately 25 members meets once a fortnight at Kirkburn Village Hall. Two hostesses are responsible for tea and cakes.Members play cards and dominoes.There is a free raffle and everybody wins something. Other activities include a birthday party in April, a summer outing, a Christmas luncheon and visits to other D & J clubs.Occasionally they attend a rally of all Humberside clubs. In 1984 Tibthorpe withdrew and the club was renamed Garton Darby and Joan.Membership costs 20p a week which includes tea.Money is also raised by jumble sales and whist drives.As Garton does not have a village hall transport to Kirkburn is a problem.
